page.title: 03The Land
page.content: As can be seen from the land cover and amenity count, the area is very rural. It is all divided into fields with well established hedgerows. There are some areas of woodland but all are small and scarcely on a commercial scale. One main road runs through the area the remainder being country lanes. The main road is just an "A" class road having been improved in places but not really suitable for heavy goods traffic. It is used primarily by commutors, many travelling to the Nuclear Power Station several miles further down the coast. Animals can be seen grazing on most of the fields, the land being fairly low lying but undulating. The highest point in the area is High Park (247m) which is not divided into fields and is fairly rough grazing land at best.
